tasks: Review the 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design (nngroup.com) and identify 3 areas where you can apply them to your current design work. Create a list of actionable steps to implement these heuristics in your next project. (Reference: https://www.nngroup.com/articles/ten-usability-heuristics/) Score improvement: +3%

Analyze your portfolio's navigation using the 8-point grid system and identify 2 areas where you can improve user flow. Redesign these sections with a clear, concise navigation. (Reference: https://lawsofux.com/aesthetic-usability-effect/)
Conduct a self-assessment of your current design process, identifying 3 pain points or inefficiencies. Create a plan to address these issues and document your findings in a 1-page report.

Apply Tesler's Law (lawsofux.com) to your current design work, identifying 3 areas where you can improve the user experience. Create a wireframe or sketch of each area and document your design decisions. Score improvement: +5%

Create a mind map or diagram illustrating the relationships between Hick’s Law (lawsofux.com), Tesler's Law, and Aesthetic-Usability Effect. Use this visual aid to help you understand how these concepts relate to user experience. Score improvement: +2%
Conduct 1 user interview using the Jobs-to-be-Done framework and document 3 pain points or opportunities for improvement. Review your findings and create a plan to address them in your next project.

Develop a comprehensive design strategy for a new product feature, incorporating principles of Product Thinking & Strategy (e.g., user needs, business goals). Create a written report outlining your design decisions and rationale. Score improvement: +10%

Create 2 personas using the Jobs-to-be-Done framework, illustrating the motivations and behaviors of your target users. Review your findings and document any insights or surprises you discovered. Score improvement: +5%

Conduct a self-assessment of your collaboration and communication skills, identifying areas for improvement. Create a plan to work on these skills, including specific actions and resources (e.g., books, courses).

Design and pitch a comprehensive redesign of your portfolio's navigation using the 8-point grid system and principles of UX Fundamentals. Present your design to a peer or mentor and receive feedback. Score improvement: +15%

Develop a written report outlining your progress over the past 4 weeks, including specific accomplishments and lessons learned. Review your findings and document any insights or surprises you discovered. Score improvement: +10%

Create a capstone project that demonstrates your mastery of Product Thinking & Strategy, incorporating principles from your design strategy developed in Week 3. Present your project to a peer or mentor and receive feedback.

resources.readup: As a Strategic Lead UX designer, you have the unique opportunity to drive business growth through user-centered design solutions. With your exceptional skills in UX Fundamentals, UI Craft & Visual Design, and Collaboration & Communication, you can effectively lead cross-functional teams to deliver innovative products that exceed user expectations.

resources.title: 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design
resources.description: 7 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design ================================================= Jakob Nielsen ![](https://media.nngroup.com/medi...

topics.name: Understanding Hick's Law and its Application in Strategic UX Design
topics.summary: As a Strategic Lead, understanding the limitations of human decision-making can inform more effective UX design decisions.
practice_points: Analyze 3 existing products or services and identify instances where Hick's Law applies. Document specific design changes that could mitigate these limitations.
Create a heuristic evaluation checklist using Hick's Law as a foundation, focusing on user interface elements like button sizes and navigation menus.

topics.name: Developing a Product Thinking Framework for Strategic UX Design
topics.summary: Strategic UX designers need to integrate product thinking into their workflow to create more effective user experiences.
practice_points: Research and document 2 successful products that have effectively integrated product thinking into their design processes. Analyze the key strategies used in these examples.

topics.name: Applying Tesler's Law to Inform Strategic UX Design Decisions
topics.summary: Tesler's Law provides insight into how users process information, helping designers make more informed decisions.
practice_points: Conduct 2 usability testing sessions using Tesler's Law as a guiding principle. Document the results and identify areas for improvement.
